_header: I shall tell you a tale
Note:
Davis (1971)
XDavis, Norman. The Paston Letters and Papers of the Fifteenth Century. 2 vols. Oxford: Clarendon, 1971, 1976, No. 528; Gairdner (1904)
XGairdner, James. The Paston Letters. 6 vols. London: Chatto & Windus, 1904; repr. Alan Sutton, 1986, No. 609.
_description: A verse letter included in a longer letter from John Paston I to Margaret Paston, 20 September 1465 — 10 couplets

BLAdd34889.First Lines:
Item I shall telle yow a talePampyng & I haue piked your
                    male…
BLAdd34889.Last Lines:
…Nomore to yow at this tymebut God hym saue þat mad this
                    ryme
BLAdd34889.Note:
Written as prose; not ed. ‘Gairdner, II.237’ as cited in
                        Robbins  and  Cutler (1965)
XRossell Hope Robbins,   and  John L. Cutler.  
             Supplement to the Index of Middle English Verse.
         Lexington, Kentucky: University of Kentucky Press, 1965.
BLAdd34889.Attributed Author: be yowr trew & trusti husband J.P. (John Paston) (f. 33v)
